Class AudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • model.AudioPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AudioPlayer
extends java.lang.Thread
    A single Thread Audio Player Once used it has to be initialised again

      • AudioPlayer

        public AudioPlayer(java.io.File audioFile,
                   javax.sound.sampled.SourceDataLine line,
                   javax.sound.sampled.LineListener lineListener,
                   int outputMode)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException
        Parameters:
        audioFile - audiofile
        line - line
        lineListener - lineListener
        outputMode - if MONO, force output to be mono; if STEREO, force output to be STEREO; if LEFT_ONLY, play a mono signal over the left channel of a stereo output, or mute the right channel of a stereo signal; if RIGHT_ONLY, do the same with the right output channel.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - UnsupportedAudioFileException

      • AudioPlayer

        public AudioPlayer(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream ais,
                   javax.sound.sampled.SourceDataLine line,
                   javax.sound.sampled.LineListener lineListener,
                   int outputMode)
        Parameters:
        ais - ais
        line - line
        lineListener - lineListener
        outputMode - if MONO, force output to be mono; if STEREO, force output to be STEREO; if LEFT_ONLY, play a mono signal over the left channel of a stereo output, or mute the right channel of a stereo signal; if RIGHT_ONLY, do the same with the right output channel.

      • setGain

        public void setGain(float fGain)
        Sets Gain value. Line should be opened before calling this method. Linear scale 0.0 <--> 1.0 Threshold Coef. : 1/2 to avoid saturation.
        Parameters:
        fGain -
